static PyObject *__pyx_pf_6tfcomb_8counting_2count_distances(CYTHON_UNUSED PyObject *__pyx_self, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_sites, PyObject *__pyx_v_rules, int __pyx_v_min_distance, int __pyx_v_max_distance, float __pyx_v_max_overlap, short __pyx_v_anchor_mode, int __pyx_v_directional) {

  int __pyx_v_TF1_start;

 202: 
 203: 	"""
 204: 	Superfast counting of TF-TF co-occurrences within a given windowsize and with a maximum overlap fraction 
 205: 	
 206: 	Parameters:
 207: 	------------
 208: 	sites : np.ndarray
 209: 		List of coordinate-lists (chr, start, stop, name) sorted by (chromosom, start)
 210: 	rules :dict
 211: 		dict of pairs (tf1 name, tf2 name): index with tf1 name, tf2 name encoded as int
 212: 	min_distance : int
 213: 		Minimum allowed distance between two TFs. Default: 0
 214: 	max_distance : int
 215: 		Maximum allowed distance between two TFs. Default: 100
 216: 	max_overlap (float): 
 217: 		maximum overlap fraction allowed e.g. 0 = no overlap allowed, 1 = full overlap allowed. Default: 0.
 218: 	anchor_mode : short
 219: 		anchor mode to calculate distance with. One of [0,1,2]. 
 220: 		0 = inner, 1 = outer, 2 = center. Default: 0
 221: 	directional : bool
 222: 		Whether to count TF1-TF2 exclusively, or count TF2-TF1 counts for the TF1-TF2 pair. Setting 'False' means TF1-TF2 counts == TF2-TF1 counts, and
 223: 		'True' means distances are only counted in the TF1-TF2 direction. Default: False.
 224: 	max_distance : int
 225: 		Size of the largest TF. Needed to determine array length in advance. Default Value is unsparing.  Default: 50
 226: 
 227: 	Returns:
 228: 	-----------
 229: 	dist_count_mat: np.ndarray
 230: 		n x (distance range) matrix. 
 231: 
 232: 
 233: 	"""
